SENT.plain: Infantile cortical hyperostosis (ICH), Caffey disease, is a multifocal, inflammatory skeletal process with classic onset before the fifth month of life and resolution by the age of 3 years
A severe phenotype with early prenatal onset has also been described
Inheritance is generally accepted a autosomal dominant with variable expression and penetrance
However, occurrence in siblings with no family history has been reported, raising the possibility of heterogeneity and the existence of a severe autosomal recessive form
We describe a third family with prenatally diagnosed ICH in two siblings, providing further evidence for this form of inheritance
